histogram.name: Startup.AfterStartupTaskCount
histogram.summary: The number of after-startup tasks that were queued prior to startup completion and deferred until that time.

histogram.name: Startup.AfterStartupTaskDelayedUntilTime
histogram.summary: Time from the process creation until deferred after-startup tasks began running.

histogram.name: Startup.Android.CachedFeedVisibilityConsistency
histogram.summary: Records whether or not the cached Feed visibility in the SharedPreferences is consistent with the Feed visibility user preference on the disk. It's recorded when overview mode is shown because of Return to Tab Switcher, and only on cold start. By recording this histogram, the number of mismatches between the criteria of whether the Feed placeholder of Instant Start pre-native is shown and the criteria of whether Feed articles after native initialization are shown is recorded.

histogram.name: Startup.Android.ChromeTabbedTaskExistsTime
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time it takes to check if a ChromeTabbedActivity task already exists during startup.

histogram.name: Startup.Android.Cold.TimeToFirstContentfulPaint
histogram.summary: Android: The time from the activity creation point to the first contentful paint of the first loaded page. It's not recorded when the first loaded page is non http(s) page like a chrome error page, a new tab page, a blank page. It's also not recorded if the application wasn't in the foreground since the start till the end of event.

histogram.name: Startup.Android.Cold.TimeToFirstNavigationCommit
histogram.summary: Android: The time from the activity creation point to the moment the first navigation is committed, i.e. when renderer gets the first byte of the document. It's not recorded when the first loaded page is non http(s) page like a chrome error page, a new tab page, a blank page. It's also not recorded if the application wasn't in the foreground since the start till the end of event.

histogram.name: Startup.Android.Cold.TimeToFirstVisibleContent
histogram.summary: The time from the activity creation point to the moment Chrome appears ready. The intent is to reflect Clank's perceived cold start performance regardless of different launch paths. The recorded value is the minimum of 'Startup.Android.Cold.TimeToFirstNavigationCommit.Tabbed' and 'Browser.PaintPreview.TabbedPlayer.TimeToFirstBitmap' metric values.

histogram.name: Startup.Android.Cold.TimeToVisibleContent
histogram.summary: Android: The time from the activity creation point to the moment the content may first appear ready to a user. The intent is to capture readiness of Chrome regardless of whether Chrome is launched into native UI or a web page. The recorded value is the minimum of 'Startup.Android.Cold.TimeToFirstContentfulPaint.Tabbed' and 'Browser.PaintPreview.TabbedPlayer.TimeToFirstBitmap' metric values.

histogram.name: Startup.Android.FeedContentFirstLoadedTime
histogram.summary: Records the time duration from a cold start till the Feeds articles are first loaded on the StartSurface. This histogram is only recorded when StartSurface is shown at launch due to "return to tab switcher" feature.

histogram.name: Startup.Android.FeedsLoadingPlaceholderShown.Instant
histogram.summary: Records the time duration from a cold start till the Feeds loading placeholder is shown on the StartSurface. This placeholder is only shown when the feature flag InstantStart is enabled and StartSurface is shown at launch due to "return to tab switcher" feature.

histogram.name: Startup.Android.FeedStreamCreatedTime
histogram.summary: Records the time duration from a cold start till the Feeds stream is created on the StartSurface. This histogram is only recorded when StartSurface is shown at launch due to "return to tab switcher" feature.

histogram.name: Startup.Android.FirstDrawCompletedTime
histogram.summary: Records the time duration from a cold start till the first draw completes.

histogram.name: Startup.Android.GURLEnsureMainDexInitialized
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time startup has likely been delayed due to GURL waiting on the native library to be initialized.

histogram.name: Startup.Android.ShowChromeStartSegmentationResult
histogram.summary: The result from segmentation platform that determines whether or not to show Start surface at startup. Recorded during startup.

histogram.name: Startup.Android.ShowChromeStartSegmentationResultComparison
histogram.summary: Records the comparison of result from segmentation and code logic for when to show Start surface at startup. Recorded during startup.

histogram.name: Startup.Android.SingleTabTitleAvailableTime
histogram.summary: Records the time duration from a cold start till the title of the single Tab is shown on the StartSurface. This histogram is only recorded when StartSurface is shown at launch due to "return to tab switcher" feature.

histogram.name: Startup.Android.StartSurfaceShownAtStartup
histogram.summary: Records whether the Start surface homepage is showing at a cold startup when the Start surface is enabled. This histogram is recorded in a deferred startup task after Chrome is launched.

histogram.name: Startup.Android.StartupTabPreloader.TabLoaded
histogram.summary: Android: Whether or not creation of a profile lead to the StartupTabPreloader speculatively created a tab. Recorded when a profile is created, assuming a StartupTabPreloader has been constructed for intents with a url and either regular Chrome or a Custom Tab will be loaded.

histogram.name: Startup.Android.StartupTabPreloader.TabTaken
histogram.summary: Android: Whether or not a tab speculatively created by the StartupTabPreloader was subsequently adopted by ChromeTabCreator. Recorded when a tab is loaded, assuming a StartupTabPreloader has been constructed for intents with a url for either regular Chrome or a Custom Tab will be loaded. Warning: this histogram was expired from 2020-11-08 through M95.

histogram.name: Startup.Android.ThumbnailFetchedForGTSFirstMeaningfulPaint
histogram.summary: Android: The number of thumbnails fetched for the first meaningful paint of the Grid Tab Switcher. First meaningful paint is defined as having all the thumbnails shown. This is recorded at most once per activity lifecycle. This is gated by feature "TabSwitcherOnReturn".

histogram.name: Startup.Android.TimeToGTSFirstMeaningfulPaint
histogram.summary: Android: The elapsed time from the activity creation point to the first meaningful paint of the Grid Tab Switcher. First meaningful paint is defined as having all the thumbnails shown. This is recorded at most once per activity lifecycle. This is gated by feature "TabSwitcherOnReturn".

histogram.name: Startup.Android.TimeToGTSFirstMeaningfulPaint.Cold
histogram.summary: Android: The elapsed time from the activity creation point to the first meaningful paint of the Grid Tab Switcher. First meaningful paint is defined as having all the thumbnails shown. This is recorded at most once per activity lifecycle. This is gated by feature "TabSwitcherOnReturn". It's only recorded on cold startup.

histogram.name: Startup.Android.TimeToGTSFirstMeaningfulPaint.Warm
histogram.summary: Android: The elapsed time from the activity creation point to the first meaningful paint of the Grid Tab Switcher. First meaningful paint is defined as having all the thumbnails shown. This is recorded at most once per activity lifecycle. This is gated by feature "TabSwitcherOnReturn". It's only recorded on warm startup.

histogram.name: Startup.BlockForCrashpadHandlerStartupTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during in crash_report::BlockUntilHandlerStarted().

histogram.name: Startup.BringToForegroundReason
histogram.summary: Records the cause, each time Chrome is brought to the foreground. Currently only checks if a NotificationUIManager notification was shown in the last 5 seconds (includes Web Notifications, but not media or Cast).

histogram.name: Startup.BrowserMainRunnerImplInitializeLongTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during BrowserMainRunnerImpl::Initialize.

histogram.name: Startup.BrowserMainRunnerImplInitializeStep1Time
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during the first section of BrowserMainRunnerImpl::Initialize.

histogram.name: Startup.BrowserMainRunnerImplInitializeStep2Time
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during the second section of BrowserMainRunnerImpl::Initialize.

histogram.name: Startup.BrowserMessageLoopFirstIdle
histogram.summary: Time from application start to the first time MainMessageLoopRun() reaches idle. This is a new (Feb'2021) metric intended to capture UI jank caused by the long queue of tasks post initialization. This is believed to capture performance issues (startup responsiveness) none of the other Startup.* metrics capture (crbug.com/1175074). Recording is dropped if blocking UI is shown before first-idle is reached (as this blocks main loop progress on unbounded user interaction).

histogram.name: Startup.BrowserMessageLoopStart.To.NonEmptyPaint2
histogram.summary: Time between Startup.BrowserMessageLoopStartTime and Startup.FirstWebContents.NonEmptyPaint2. Recorded explicitly to allow easy breakdown of Startup.FirstWebContents.NonEmptyPaint2 when diagnosing issues.

histogram.name: Startup.BrowserMessageLoopStartHardFaultCount
histogram.summary: The number of hard faults incurred in the browser process from startup to start of the main thread's message loop, not including first runs of the browser.

histogram.name: Startup.BrowserMessageLoopStartTime
histogram.summary:
Time from application start to the start of the main thread's message loop. Not recorded for first run.
April 8, 2020: Changed the reference from process creation to application start. See Startup.FirstWebContents.NonEmptyPaint3 for a definition of application start.

histogram.name: Startup.BrowserMessageLoopStartTime.FirstRun
histogram.summary:
Time from application start to the start of the main thread's message loop. Recorded for a first run of the browser.
April 8, 2020: Changed the reference from process creation to application start. See Startup.FirstWebContents.NonEmptyPaint3 for a definition of application start.

histogram.name: Startup.BrowserProcessImpl_PreMainMessageLoopRunTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during BrowserProcessImpl::PreMainMessageLoopRun.

histogram.name: Startup.BrowserWindow.FirstPaint
histogram.summary:
Time from application start to the time the first Browser window has finished painting its children.
April 8, 2020: Changed the reference from process creation to application start. See Startup.FirstWebContents.NonEmptyPaint3 for a definition of application start.

histogram.name: Startup.BrowserWindow.FirstPaint.CompositingEnded
histogram.summary:
Time from application start to the time the GPU has finished compositing after first Browser window has finished painting its children. At this point the Browser interface is visible on screen. Measures how much time does it take for GPU to actually paint the first time.
April 8, 2020: Changed the reference from process creation to application start. See Startup.FirstWebContents.NonEmptyPaint3 for a definition of application start.

histogram.name: Startup.BrowserWindowDisplay
histogram.summary:
Time from application start to the time the browser window initially becomes visible.
April 8, 2020: Changed the reference from process creation to application start. See Startup.FirstWebContents.NonEmptyPaint3 for a definition of application start.

histogram.name: Startup.ColdStartFromProcessCreationTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed 03/2021. Broken starting M-87; removed and replaced with Startup.ColdStartFromProcessCreationTimeV2 in M-91.
histogram.summary: The duration of all initializations from process creation time to UI ready. This includes code loading, static initializers and the execution time contained in Startup.ColdStartWithExternalURLTime and Startup.ColdStartWithoutExternalURLTime metrics. iOS specific. Deprecated due to incomplete data from M87 to M91. The data is incomplete because it was not logged in iOS 13+. See Startup.ColdStartFromProcessCreationTimeV2 instead.

histogram.name: Startup.ColdStartFromProcessCreationTimeV2
histogram.summary:
The duration of all initializations from process creation time to UI ready to receive input. iOS specific, from M91+
The process can only be created in response to a user action, either tapping the icon, tapping a link that opens in Chrome, or using the app switcher to switch to Chrome after it has been background-killed by the OS.
The metric is recorded at the point where the Chrome window starts receiving input events like touches and keypresses. However, the Chrome splash screen is showing at this point, so there aren't any UI elements for a user to interact with.
It includes code loading, static initializers and the execution time contained in Startup.ColdStartWithExternalURLTime and Startup.ColdStartWithoutExternalURLTime metrics.
The total counts in this histogram can be compared with the number of emits to the user action MobileWillEnterForeground. The former reports the number of cold starts. The latter is only recorded when Chrome comes to the foreground on non-cold starts.
Do not modify this metric in any way without contacting chrome-analysis-team@google.com.

histogram.name: Startup.ColdStartWithExternalURLTime
histogram.summary: The duration of all initializations in a cold start triggered by an external URL.

histogram.name: Startup.ColdStartWithoutExternalURLTime
histogram.summary: The duration of all initializations in a cold start not triggered by an external URL.

histogram.name: Startup.ConsecutiveLoadsWithoutLaunch
histogram.summary: [IOS] The number of time +load was called but no scene was activated. Recorded when first scene is becomes active.

histogram.name: Startup.CreateFirstProfile
histogram.summary: How long it takes to load the original profile synchronously on the UI thread.

histogram.name: Startup.DoUpgradeTasks.{Status}
histogram.summary: Records the time it took to complete upgrade_util::DoUpgradeTasks() when {Status}.

histogram.name: Startup.FirstWebContents.FinishReason
histogram.summary: [Desktop] The reason for which startup profiling was deemed complete. Logged once per session on startup.

histogram.name: Startup.FirstWebContents.MainNavigationFinished
histogram.summary:
[Desktop] Measure the elapsed time from application start to the moment when the navigation is committed (first bytes received) in the first web contents' main frame.
April 8, 2020: Changed the reference from process creation to application start. See Startup.FirstWebContents.NonEmptyPaint3 for a definition of application start.

histogram.name: Startup.FirstWebContents.MainNavigationStart
histogram.summary:
[Desktop] Measure the elapsed time from application start to the beginning of navigation in the first web contents' main frame.
April 8, 2020: Changed the reference from process creation to application start. See Startup.FirstWebContents.NonEmptyPaint3 for a definition of application start.

histogram.name: Startup.FirstWebContents.NonEmptyPaint3
histogram.summary:
Measure the elapsed time from the application start to the first non empty paint of the first web contents. Only comprised of cases where the initial foreground tab gets to complete its rendering task unimpeded (an improvement over Startup.FirstWebContents.NonEmptyPaint).
Application start is a time recorded as early as possible in the startup process. On Android, the application start is the time at which the Java code starts. On Windows, application start is when chrome.exe:main starts, before chrome.dll is loaded. On other platforms, it is when ChromeMainDelegate is constructed.
Do not modify this metric in any way without contacting chrome-analysis-team@google.com.

histogram.name: Startup.FirstWebContents.RenderProcessHostInit.ToNonEmptyPaint
histogram.summary: Time between RenderFrameHostImpl::Init and Startup.FirstWebContents.NonEmptyPaint2.

histogram.name: Startup.IncognitoForcedStart
histogram.summary: Records whether Incognito switch was present in commmand line switches and if Incognito mode was enforced or denied. This is recorded during browser startup when commandline is processed.

histogram.name: Startup.LoadTime.ApplicationStartToChromeMain
histogram.summary: Time from the application start to the C++ ChromeMain() function being invoked.

histogram.name: Startup.LoadTime.ProcessCreateToApplicationStart
histogram.summary: Time from the process creation to application start, i.e. time recorded as early as possible in the startup process.

histogram.name: Startup.MobileSessionStartAction
histogram.summary: The action requested on the application startup when called from another app or the OS.

histogram.name: Startup.MobileSessionStartFromApps
histogram.summary: The calling application (if any).

histogram.name: Startup.OSX.AwakeFromNib
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed between main entry and the invocation of -[AppControllerMac awakeFromNib].

histogram.name: Startup.OSX.DockIconWillFinishBouncing
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed between main entry and the invocation of -[AppControllerMac didFinishLaunching:]. At that point, the dock icon will finish its current animation and stop bouncing.

histogram.name: Startup.OSX.PostMainMessageLoopStart
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed between main entry and the invocation of ChromeBrowserMainPartsMac::PostMainMessageLoopStart.

histogram.name: Startup.OSX.PostProfileInit
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed between main entry and the invocation of ChromeBrowserMainPartsMac::PostProfileInit.

histogram.name: Startup.OSX.PreMainMessageLoopStart
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed between main entry and the invocation of ChromeBrowserMainPartsMac::PreMainMessageLoopStart.

histogram.name: Startup.OSX.PreProfileInit
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed between main entry and the invocation of ChromeBrowserMainPartsMac::PreProfileInit.

histogram.name: Startup.OSX.WillFinishLaunching
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed between main entry and the invocation of -[AppControllerMac willFinishLaunching:].

histogram.name: Startup.PreMainMessageLoopRunImplLongTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during ChromeBrowserMainParts::PreMainMessageLoopRunImpl.

histogram.name: Startup.StartupBrowserCreator_Start
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during StartupBrowserCreator::Start().

histogram.name: Startup.StartupTaskRunner.AsyncTaskQueueTime
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time that tasks added to StartupTaskRunner were queued before running. Logged every time that a task is run asynchronously with a valid queue time in StartupTaskRunner.

histogram.name: Startup.Temperature
histogram.summary: Indicates whether or not the given startup was warm, cold or unable to be determined. This is based off observing the number of hard faults that occur during startup prior to Startup.BrowserMessageLoopStartTime. The threshold for cold startup was updated Jan 2020, a bump in the metric is expected.

histogram.name: Startup.TimeFromProcessCreationToDidFinishLaunchingCall
histogram.summary: [IOS] The duration between process spawn (returned by sysctl) and call to [UIApplicationDelegate didFinishLaunching:]. Recorded when first scene is becomes active.

histogram.name: Startup.TimeFromProcessCreationToLoad
histogram.summary: [IOS] The duration between process spawn (returned by sysctl) and library load (logged on +load method). Recorded when first scene is becomes active.

histogram.name: Startup.TimeFromProcessCreationToMainCall
histogram.summary: [IOS] The duration between process spawn (returned by sysctl) and call to main. Recorded when first scene is becomes active.

histogram.name: Startup.TimeFromProcessCreationToSceneConnection
histogram.summary: [IOS] The duration between process spawn (returned by sysctl) and call to the first scene connection. Recorded when first scene is becomes active.

histogram.name: Startup.WebFooterExperiment.DidFirstVisuallyNonEmptyPaint
histogram.summary:
Time from application start until the first web footer finishes painting.
April 8, 2020: Changed the reference from process creation to application start. See Startup.FirstWebContents.NonEmptyPaint3 for a definition of application start.

histogram.name: Startup.WebFooterExperiment.WebFooterCreation
histogram.summary:
Time from application start until the first WebView used to display a web footer is created.
April 8, 2020: Changed the reference from process creation to application start. See Startup.FirstWebContents.NonEmptyPaint3 for a definition of application start.
